ej,hooph101,P,rowlp801,Call at HP Harry Hooper ejected by HP umpire Pants Rowland Harry Hooper, coaching 3B, was ejected by Ump Rowland for protesting the decision at home
Stephenson backed into the RF crowd to make catch

Since the 1st inning, several thousand fans had been allowed to occupy territory in foul ground behind 3B.  This made it impossible for box patrons to see the game without standing up.  In the top of the 9th, someone in the stand fired a cushion at someone standing out in the field.  In a minute the air was full of cushions coming out and being fired back.  The game was halted for several minutes until the escapade was subdued.

$Knode either dropped the throw (CPD) or failed to touch the bag (NY Times/Chi Daily Trib). The crowd swarmed over the field thinking the game was over. Umpires and police attempted to clear the field, but were helpless.  The game was forfeited to CLE
A cold win blew in from the lake CDT=5000

Davis held 1B on Speaker's throw home
Kamm just knocked it down with his bare hand
Sheely tried to stab the bad throw just as Sewell crashed into him and the ball got away.
Sewell avoided Collins' tag per Ump Rowland, but Collins argued Sewell ran out of the base line.  He even went out to show the umpire where Sewell's spike marks were.
Davis' throw to 1B was too late for DP
Davis injured his ankle colliding with Burns
Indians protested Ump Rowland's safe call at 2B.  Rowland indicated Fewster had juggled Myatt's throw.

'Spectacular stop...grabbing the ball backward, turning and throwing out the runner.  It was great work.'

Mogridge was hit in the head by Barrett's knee while fielding the slow roller and dropped the ball.  The play caused a dispute; Ump McGowan first called Barrett out for interference but was overruled by Ump Ormsby.
A pitch wide of the plate on hit & run
Barrett knocked it loose with a feet-first slide

Spectacular diving catch; Falk slid on his elbow as he landed but held onto the ball. Fans went wild with applause.

The pitch broke in, hit Kamm's bat without him swinging at it, and died just in front of the plate.  Ruel tagged him.
Caught at the edge of the bleachers

Vicious fly toward LF bleachers veered sharply toward the foul line, caromed off the foul pole, and bounded into the grandstand in foul territory.  Ward circled the bases, but after an umpire conference, was returned to 2B under ground rules. CDT: Ground rules state that if a ball hits the pole and bounds into the stand or over the fence, it is a double, otherwise it is good for all a man can get. NYTimes: 'The reason for this rule is shrouded in deep mystery, but there it stands nevertheless.'
Close play on tag by Ward who protested the decision
Ward was spiked by Mostil on throw to 2B
Mostil and many other Sox players protested Ump McGowan's decision at 3B.

Paschal tried a shoestring catch but it got by him
The weather was cold.  Winter overcoats, earmuffs, and mittens were all the mode.

Lyons fell as he tried to field it
Combs was going on the 3-2 pitch; Davis may have hurried
Combs' rough slide into Kamm brought jeers from the crowd. Kamm's throw to 1B was spoiled by the slide, but it looked accidental.  Collins protested the interference to Ump Dinneen to no avail.
Lyons whirled and made a quick, rifle shot throw

Johnson was knocked down by a terrific liner off Falk's bat, the ball caroming off his cheek to Neun who touched 1B. Johnson was helped off the field, but fainted just before reaching the dugout. Teammates carried him to the clubhouse. He was then taken to the hospital.

Johnny Mostil Day at Comiskey Park. A couple thousand fans from Mostil's home town of Whiting, Indiana, presented him with a $600 diamond ring and a travel bag before the game.

CDT=30K, PDT=33K According to PDL, a new PHA batting order was created out of a consensus vote by the players in an effort to stop their 5-game losing streak.  It paid off immediately.
Bounced into the grandstands near the end of the foul line

CDT: Collins knocked it down and in some way stepped on the ball.  It threw off his balance and he dropped with his left leg twisted under him.  He tried to get up and grab the ball but the prop wouldn't hold him; he fell again.  Trainer Buckner and Eddie Rommel helped him off the field in intense pain.  X-rays later showed a pulled tendon in his left hip. PDL: With the infield in Collins dashed to his left, dove, and got a glove on it.  As it rolled toward RF he got up and pursued it, dragging his leg.  Miller scored as Collins got to it; he collapsed and had to be carried off the field. WP: In lunging forward, Collins stopped quickly and tore several muscles in his left leg.  He fell in agony and it was several minutes before he was removed to the club house. NYT: Collins stepped on a ball hit toward 2B and wrenched a muscle in his left leg.  He was carried off the field but it was announced after the game his injury was not serious.
